body: The budget of this task is **30 mins**. This is exactly how much time will be compensated, when the task is completed.
@asinyagin it's yours now, please proceed keeping in mind [our principles](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/principles). Feel free to ask any technical questions right here in the ticket

@yegor256 As far as I understand, there is no pagination in releases (http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/releases/#list-releases-for-a-repository). So I don't need to use RtPagination. Am I correct?
Why do you think there is no pagination?

Maybe I'm misunderstanding something. Response with repository commits, for example, has a Link header (http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/commits/#list-commits-on-a-repository), but response with repository releases don't.

I think it's a bug in their documentation. For example list of assignees also doesn't have pagination: http://developer.github.com/v3/issues/assignees/#list-assignees Let's assume that pagination _may_ exist there

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

body: Pull request for this issue has been merged. I think the issue should be closed.
@asinyagin **30 mins** added to your account (payment number `DA2108396`), many thanks for your contribution!
